REVIEW_BODY: This mall is located at the vicinity of Little India. Best place for shopping. There is a $2 shop Daiso at level 4. There is a theatre at level 5. Lot of eataries at level 1 and basement 1. Clothes brands like uniqlo and cotton on are at level 1. Can spend 3 hours here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Shopping Mall with Spacious Donki Japanese Store
REVIEW_BODY:
Honestly I went here for shopping at Donki Store. There you can all things Japanese, from grocery, confectionery, seasoning & spices, snacks, drinks, ready to eat bento meals, up to toiletries, cosmetic, skin care items as well as other knick-knacks and fancy cutesy stuff to satisfy your shopaholic desires.
Other than that, the mall is relatively big and convenient, it has got small playground right outside the building with sqings and slide for the little ones.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fragrance bak kwa at City Square Mall
REVIEW_BODY:
Wonderful pork jerky(bak kwa) and fish skin chips.
Fragrance shop is actually all over singapore. We saw at chinatown, at orchard and at the airport.
They have good items for you to buy and send as gift to family & friends hence tge bak kwa and fish skin.
Nice mall with lot of activities inside. You can find a metro station below this mall. Daiso (2 Dollar shop) is the main attraction at 4th floor of this mall.

REVIEW_TITLE: Small mall but with many restaurants and shops and a cinema
REVIEW_BODY: This mall full of restaurants and shops plus NTUC supermarket, i like to come here with my family to watch movie as it is less crowded and before the movie start we always shop around at the Donki shop, Diaso shop ... or sometimes eat at the restaurants like Din Tai Fung ..or buy some groceries from the NTUC supermarket.

I love going to City Square Mall not because is 8mins walking distance. This Mall has everything that we needed and place for my kids too. Sometimes, will just let my kids play the playground and walk back home. During PH, weekends and evenings there are crowds. So, if you want to have the shop to yourself better on weekdays or weekends mornings before 12pm.

At the heart of Singapore, one can find everything here. Food court offers quality food & drinks including HALAL foods. Cineplex is lovely, they even have unique hanging game house for the youngsters. For the sports enthusiasts Decathlon is a must visit. Compared to Singapore, the place is not very expensive. Loved visiting the place.
Has a lot of play options across ages. Good place to keep the kids engaged. Cost was reasonable and good eating places in level 4 to have your fill

REVIEW_TITLE: Bad Experience with a CIty Square Mall Tenant
REVIEW_BODY:
City Square Mall is a pretty good mall for people living or staying around the area as it is comprehensive, comprising many amenities and shops to cater to everyone's needs. There are some big retail shops there (e.g. Donki Donki, Decathlon, just to name a few) and hence, it is often crowded. In my view, is a good mall to hangout, go for food or get your daily necessities. It is also conveniently located right at a MRT, making it easily accessible.

When I was there yesterday, my son and I went into the Play E store at #B2-44 of the mall. It is a store that sells toys and computer merchandises catered mainly to children and teenagers. In short, the service and attitude of the salesperson was so bad that it left a sour taste in my mouth. We wanted to purchase some items (which my son liked very much) from the shop (the items were on display with price tags clearly shown) and he refused to sell to us without any reason. I tried to reason but he could only answer "there is no reason, I just don't want to sell to you". We left with my son feeling affected and sad.

While this rather substandard and disgraceful service may just be an one-off incident and may not be reflective of the service quality of the rest of the Play E outlets, the tenants in City Square Mall or Singapore, the Management of City Square Mall and Play E should really look into the operations of this particular outlet. We do not want to have tourists experiencing such poor service and leave with a bad note on our service quality; and our young children being helplessly turned away with disappointment

It only takes one bad experience to ruin the whole day.

REVIEW_TITLE: City square mall on kitchener road
REVIEW_BODY:
We’ll connected by metro and other transport. Farrer park station is connected to this mall. This mall has good brands from charles and keith to giordano and many other stuff.
Near to mustafa centre, so can cover them both in a single day. Many good shops are in this mall you must go and check out that.

Pleasantly surprised by the City Square Mall in Little India. It was adjacent to my hotel and had lots of shopping experiences here. Lot of options for Kids for play while you can shop around. Quite a mall with good shops all around. Food court in the basement and food republic court on top floor for you to be satisfied.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to shop and eat
REVIEW_BODY:
We stayed few days nearby. In evenings we went to the mall to have dinner. They have a considerable number of restaurants. My mom, who prefers vegetarian food, also had many options in this mall to enjoy.
There are some grocery shops as well.

Many of the staff in shops / restaurants were friendly and helpful.
Many shopping outlets and food choices here. Food court on top floor has nice ambiences and prices are inexpensive. Clean toilets also! Good to go with family

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice huge mall for the family
REVIEW_BODY:
When the mall was first opened it was empty. But after a few years it managed to transform itself into a buzzing mall especially during weekends. It is connected to the farrer park MRT and located near little India. It has a wide range of tenants such as Decathlon for sporting needs, Uniqlo for clothing, plenty of furniture shops, many eateries at every level, Daiso and some book shops and even a cinema.
It also has many tuition centres at the higher floors.
Many activities for kids such as play gyms/indoor playgrounds and kids clothings such as Fox and even ToysRus.
Plenty of parking space but it feels up very fast on weekends. Valet parking is available.

If you're here in Singapore as a tourist then would be probably better to be somewhere more iconic like Orchad road or MBS. If you're a local this definitely is a fun place to hangout. Great food selection, cinema, ATMs, great activities for kids plus a really convenient location close to Mustafa and on top of Farrer Park MRT

We found a Korean hotpot join at the basement 2 of this shopping mall I think. The hot pot was very reasonably priced and for a few dollars more, you can get a free flow of soft drinks, tea and coffee.

REVIEW_TITLE: A few stores that reminded me of home.
REVIEW_BODY: There is a Dunkin Donut, McDonalds and a (now defunct in the US) Toys-R-Us in that mall. There is a children's play area where the children are (safely) suspended by nets between floors in the mall SG$18 per child.

I was initially impressed that the sign out the front said that it was Singapore's "first eco mall".
But...
I went to the supermarket downstairs and everyone was having their purchases put into single use plastic bags that the supermarket provided! Then I went to the fruit section hoping to buy a few pieces of fruit for the two of us for next morning's breakfast. This was not possible as fruit such as apples and kiwis were boxed up in plastic trays of six, then further wrapped in clear plastic. I didn't need six kiwis, only two, and I certainly didn't want to support all that wasteful plastic consumption. :-( :-(

City Square mall is located on the Kitchener Road, Singapore
As we were residing are Park Royal Hotel, this mall was just across the road.... it surely did have some good brands for shopping and big eating joints which was a blessing after a long tiring day.

2-3 hours can easily be spent here even if you plan to do window shopping, but, for sure, you will not come out empty handed.

As a tourist what attracted me most apart from the famous brands was the $2 shop,Daiso, located on the 4th floor of this mall which had mostly Japanese stuff which looked quite good and reasonable, surely worth visiting.

Also Fair Price departmental store is good and some good deals can be found.

My kids love this place.

There are many activities for the kids. Outdoor playground, train, indoor playgrounds, toysrus, sand art, etc. There are also afew bookstores selling stuff for kids.

Plenty of choices for sports items at Decathlon, at 2nd floor. There’s also daiso and fairprice.

Dining options are plenty. My kids love Saizeriya and Ding Tai Fung. Pizza hut often has promotions to let kids eat for free too. We like to chill at Cedele too.

I like to check out kids clothings at the basement, namely Fox and Cotton On.

There’s a Best Denki too. This place is links to Farrer Park Mrt which is very convenient.

REVIEW_TITLE: Poor Review for the accessibility to Movie Theatre
REVIEW_BODY: Poor planning for accessibility after late movie (any movie ends after mall closure at 10pm) as I could only get out of the movie theatre via 1 single working lift that only goes to B1 to B3 (car park levels). All other access routes via staircase, escalator or other lifts were not available. As I didn't drive there, I have to walk across the car park to exit the building. I can't imagine what will happen if there is a cause for alarm (e.g. fire) or huge groups. Security guard was of no help as he asked us to use lifts, escalator or stairways that were blocked.

Decent mall with your normal Cotton Ons and Esprits. Some restaurants and upstairs food market. Farrer Park MTR-station downstairs. Very near Little India which is not the nicest area of the town and thus perhaps gives the mall a tad tarnished flavor. City Squeare mall is definitely not a fancy mall, but works for everyday use

It's quite a good shopping mall. I came here everyday because it's close to One farrer Hotel and spa, the hotel that I stayed in. I especially like the Food Republic Food Court in this City Square Mall. Most of the food that I tried here are nice. I like the Hongkong Dim Sum, the Korean food also nice and Grill chicken in Ayam Penyet is also nice. They also have some carousel for little children outside the mall for the Chinese new year celebration when I was there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Shopping Mall near Little India
REVIEW_BODY: City square mall is conveniently located. It has all sorts of shops such as a supermarket, pharmacies, clothing stores, toy shops, food outlets and many more. There is a nice food court on the top floor.We enjoyed shopping there. Kids has fun in the Game Zone. Must go place for shopping if you are in the area.

Seriously unique experience for my boys. Boys were there last night and love it. Guess, we will keep going. My 10 year old share with me as I m afraid of high, I should give it a goal. He suggest it would definitely help me to overcome the high as is really awesome. Boys love it and had heaps of fun , running up and down. There are Ball pit, slide and maze. I did not try as I m really afraid of high. I reckon is about 6 level up. Not sure tho. Staff are always at hand to help the boys. Great
staff and great playground. What I like most is indoor and boys can have a great workout. Mayb next time I ll give it a goal.

The city square mall is inhort of the city especially duri g this in the eve of christmas month very beautifully decorated and worth to enjoy .In the mall we will find all type of shop hotels etc., And for kids and children play ground and computerised playing groups is the kids will enjoy
Visit the Decathlon at Level-3, they have almost anything about Sports at fair price! The food stalls at Level-5 is good too with nice environment.

If i go to Little India for meal, most of the time will visit this mall. It is one of the eco-friendly mall. Not much shopping place but all the needed are there. There are quite a few interesting restaurant there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice small mall with great food options
REVIEW_BODY:
Nice Mall for shopping and dining. Not so crowded on weekdays. You can eat cheap at the foodcourt on the top level, Food Republic, with nice little hawkerstalls. Great Asian food:)

On the B levels you also can find a lot of foodoptions. I Recommend the Crave Nasi Lemak from Adam Rood and a little sushi stall called Kushi Sushi, cheap prices and great quality sushi. Made to Order.
Found this place by accident. Ended up having an ice cream as we walked around. Lots of good shops and had a few sales on at the lower levels. Good air conditioning to get out of the heat.

REVIEW_TITLE: New Interesting Shops at City Square Mall
REVIEW_BODY:
On 15 August 2017, my sister and I went to JB's City Square Mall. From Singapore, we took the MRT to Woodlands, in which we transferred to bus interchange to take bus 913, to the Woodlands Train Checkpoint which is located beside the Woodlands Checkpoint. There are also other bus services at the bus interchange such as 950, 856, 903, 911, and 912 which would bring you to the Checkpoint or near the Checkpoint. It is highly recommended to take this route as taking the bus services (bus services 160 and 170 at opposite Kranji MRT) of usual route are usually very packed and having difficulty getting onboard.

At bus stop beside Woodlands Train Checkpoint, we proceed to the taxi stand, then we took the escalator up then walked the one-way route (go with the crowd) to the Woodlands Checkpoint. After had our passport checked, we proceed to take Malaysia's CW bus service, through there are alternative Singapore bus services such as 170 and 160. Each CW ticket cost 1.50 RM or 1 SGD. We paid cash upon on boarding the bus and the driver provided receipts to each of us. The bus travelled across the Woodlands causeway and to Johor Bahru's Checkpoint. After walked out off the Checkpoint having our passport checked, we acrossed the overhead bridge to opposite to City Square Mall.

Beside the City Square Mall there is another mall, Komtar JBCC. This mall is known for having a Angry Bird Activity Park inside. It is a very big, new, modern mall. There are restaurants such a Fish Manhattan, Tony Roman, Dragon-i, Pizza Hut and others. There are also departmental stores (MetroJaya), pharmacy (The Caring pharmacy), clothing store (F.O.S) and others.

After a short visit to Komtar JBCC, we walked over to City Square Mall. City Square Mall is a modern mall that has shops that ranges from Fashion, Food and Beverages, Beauty and Wellness, Electonics, Gifts, Toys and Books, and even Entertainment such as a Cinema which located at levels 5, 6 and 7.

Comparing with my previous visit at 2015, there are several new interesting shops such as, DC Super Heroes Cafe (Level 2), Super Heroes (Level 2), Din Tai Fung (Level 2), and Original Cake (Level 3). Do try dining at Din Tai Fung, which provides reasonable prices (when compare with Singapore outlets), good services and good ambience which way better than Canton-i. One of the top favourites is the Pork Dumpling which has soup oozing out of the dumpling. Beside Din Tai Fung is the DC Super Heroes Cafe, which provides affordable prices on coffee and cakes. The ambience is great and you feel that you are seated in the DC Comic World with Batman, Wonder Woman and others. As for Original Cakes, their cakes is something worth waiting for as their Castella cake is famous in Taiwan, and shop closes once cakes are sold out. Other than the new shops in the mall, do check out other shops like Canton-i, Seasons, H&M, Yong Sheng Gift Shop, Action City, Cotton On, Red Eye, Uniqlo, Famous Amos and others.

As Mid-Autumn festival is coming, the mall has organised Mid-Autumn festival fair where different vendors are selling Mooncakes at the level 1. You will be able to sample different variety of Mooncakes and be in the Mid-Autumn festival mood. Do try the less sugar Mooncakes as it is trendy and better for health.

Even if it wasn't Mid-Autumn festival, shoppers are usually there for cheaper things due to the exchange rate, such as, restaurant food, Malaysia local products and branded products. However, take note of some of their restrooms which may not too up to standard. You may encountered issues, such as insufficient cubicles, wet floor, lack of toilet paper, and no hand soap. Despite the high human traffic at the checkpoint, you would not regret as their quality product are cheaper. To Singaporeans, it is like a "mini affordable getaway".

From my previous experiences of avoiding high volume human traffic, avoid weekends and long weekends. I usually go during weekdays. As the mall opening hours is around 11am, I am at the checkpoint around 10 plus. I usually leave the mall at 4pm to avoid high volume human traffic.

Going to the toilet and some of it doesnt seems to have pipe. Expecting people using the thinnest tissue provided? Some of the toilet doesnt have and some of it have, but still we need to que up to finish our business. While waiting all the workers are smoking in the toilet, we bring kids and the toilet is smelly enough plus with the smoke is not healthy. The janitor and guard just walk pass by doesnt stop people from smoking in the toilet. Some janitor sit in the toilet and lock the door just playing his phone. No water sound heard, he just lock to take a rest. While we were waiting to do our business. Bad Mall. Fix this matter please. Its a shame for us foreigner to experience this kind of matter while we were on vacation.

This shopping mall has almost everything you need.

The best part of it is that there is a cinema although the mall is in the midst of a Neighbourhood.

What is lacking is a departmental store like Isetan. The mall used to have Metro and it closed down after a few years. It will be good to have a large departmental store as everything can be found within the same place.

Mall is child friendly and family oriented as well.

Well Singapore is known for big mega malls,This to contrast is not a very big mall but fortunately it's one of the best malls in town.Its very useful everything is here and not a single store that doesn't make sense. It's one of my favorite mall is Singapore,Ver effective,You can almost complete all your shopping needs from here,Must visit when in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have everything u r looking for!!
REVIEW_BODY:
As the title says it has everything one can expect to have in mall. U have almost every famous fast food corners.
U have all coffee and cafes. U have famous fashion brandz...plus amazing restaurants covering Asian to continental to east to western.. and this is not enough then u have amazing kids play area plus lots of other family activities.

Worth visit . Do try.
One of the best malls in Singapore. Gets almost all brands in this mall Not very crowded even on Sundays.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the Best... you get everything here if you live in Park Royal on Kitchener Road.
REVIEW_BODY:
This mall is opposite to Park Royal on Kitchener Road but it has be one of the best malls I have seen. It made our entire trip so convenient. There is a Metro station at the end of it called as Farrer Park from where you can go to any part of the city. The mall itself has a supermarket, Mcdonalds, Dunkin Doughnuts and may other eateries including a chinese joint right on the top where I got to eat my fav roast duck with sticky rice.

Shopping wise also it has lots to offer and we also purchased our sim cards from here as the ones at the airport were giving expensive schemes and the ones in the mall were more tourist friendly.

REVIEW_TITLE: This is my third favorite mall in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Obviously not as good as Vivo and Plaza Singapura, but pretty good selection of food, unfortunately hot hot pot in the food court shut down, but hopefully they will replace it with somthing equally delicious.

A very conveniently located mall opposite the Park Royal hotel at Kirchner road. You will practically find everything you need here. Stores like Toys R Us, Apple, Decathlon etc offer a huge variety for shopping fanatics.

I liked the place for the eating joints mainly. This mall has atleast 20 non Asian eating options and that's practically a lot. Only issue perhaps is the last order order which is 9.45 PM and all outlets will simply throw you out by 10 PM. Singapore rules, apparently.

Do try Swenson's. They have the best Mac and Cheese.
This was close to our hotel so we went for a visit even though I had read bad reviews. Great shopping centre, more local than touristy. Tech shops as well as pop up stores. Food hall.

When I read that it was an eco mall, I was expecting more. It only has some messages and stuff spread around the mall.
I went for the outdoor playground, but as it has no cover whatsoever, all the toys become super hot and it becomes unusable.
I liked the food choice - varied and overall cheap.
There are many indoor attractions for kids, but all quite pricey.

REVIEW_TITLE: More new face stores coming up
REVIEW_BODY:
It a good place for nice food with the many choice of restaurants there
Now with cinemas available, it will be a cool place to hang around whole day during meet up with friends to have lunch there, catch a show, have dinner and a bit of shopping done

Travelled with young children and parents.

1. Food: good variety of Pizza and lPastas. Had a good Vegetarian options as well. Food was above average and tasty. Though Kids spaghetti pasta was half cooked and we provided feedback to service in charge.

2. Ambience: It was decent.
3. Service: Restaurant has self-service.
4. Price: Its cheaper than Pizza Hut and Dominos. There is no GST when you order at restaurant.

Overall, its value for money and good food.

This shopping mall is located in Little India, very close to Mustafa Center. It is not too big, but has everything you need. Very nice and clean food court with a good selecion. On the 2nd floor they have Decatholon, a very reasonably priced sporting good store. The mall is directly connected to Farrer Park MRT (NE7), very convenient. Definitely worth a visit.

As malls go, there are plenty of better ones, but this will suffice for a bite to eat as it has a food court and some shops.

The basement houses a post office, laundry service and kids shops like toys r us.

However, if your looking for a bit of everything that's not branded the Mustafa centre which is 24 hours, across the road, has most things.
It's a mall which has very reasonably priced goods and clothes etc. It has cinema halls and they are very good. One of the departmental stores has very reasonably priced items
Closes to Farrer park station of MRT, access way between mall and station at basement. There are food court, shopping mall... Really good for family use.

this mall has everything almost. you can sit on the park while your kid enjoys a train ride or play on the play ground. there are small games to enjoy as well. the mall has grocery, electronics, food court, cinema hall, clothing outlets, jewelry shops, VDO games corner etc.

Service here is way below minimal expectation. All working staff are not carrying any good attitude at all. Kitchen Chef or assistants are seen walking around, chatting, but not helping us or serving us. No one approach us to explain that we have to self serve, or to place order at the cashier. Even our experience at McDonald is way better than this. This restaurant basically projects the image of 'not interested in any customer' mentality. If you looking for pasta food for teens/children, I strongly suggest you try some other restaurants in the same building. As a local resident, as well as a foreigner, I do not recommend this restaurant at all.

City Square mall is connected to the Farrer Park MRT and close to Mustafas. City Mall is on a historic site of New World Amusement Park opened by 2 brothers under their company Ong Sam Leong Ltd. Stone throw away is the Sam Leong Road off Jalan Besar. The famous "roggeng" dancers from neighbouring countries use to woo men here for a dance under the watchful eyes of the bouncers. This old amusement park use to house State Theatre in the early days for English, Hindi, Malay and other movies. One entrance was from the junction of Kitchener Road and Serangoon Road and the other entrance is from Jalan Besar. This mall closed down in the late April 1987 but it amused the locals and tourist from 1920s. It was the home to striptease queen Rose Chan, wrestler King Kong, strongman MatTarzan without his Jane and boxer Felix Boy.

In World War 2 the Japanese named this place Shin Segal and turned this into a gambling den for the civilians to congregate but not for the Japanese soldiers. This was a place for black market selling our daily neccessities and exhorbitant prices.

The only thing that is left of New World is the gateway at the junction of Kitchener Road and Serangoon Road leading to City Square Mall.

The shopping in City Square Mall is pleanty to tickle your interest and restaurants, food kiosk and food court to drool your taste buds. This mall has a variety shopping list from branded to unbranded but originals shoes to bags, clothes to personal accessories, sports and ofcourse Toys "R" Us for women, men and children.

The food stretches from East to West Cuisines from a simple food kiosk to food court to restaurants. There is also a good collection of winery, reasonably priced to famous wines on the Basement 1 near the escalator for you to bring back.

For sports enthusiast go to Sportslink and look for UncleYeo who will give you a very personalised service on the best fit for your feet. I got my shoes here at a reasonable price. Uncle Yeo attended to my friends and relatives and all feels good with their choice of shoes with the advice of Uncle Yeo's. Uncle Yeo works only on weekdays.

The Golden Village in located on the 5th Level for your movies and pop corn.

There a number of things to do here, whatever your needs are one thing for sure you have a variety of coffee outlets from local to international for you rest and relax. Enjoy your trip to this place with your family.
Same old same old gathered from all over. No fresh touch. Too tuck away to even want to make that effort.

This mall was bang opposite the hotel I was staying at so we visited quite often. The shopping options are a bit limited but still enjoyable. The food court is nice by no options for vegetarians. We could only go to the coffee shops for quick bites. It has some nice activities for kids.
The place has variety of play options for kids and food options as well. With very close proximity to Mustafa center this place really worth a visit.

This shopping mall is not huge but spacious, comfortable and well designed to fit and satisfy shoppers wants at one stop. There are plenty different kinds of eateries and food kiosks, supermarket, provisional stores, toys, stores for daily articles, confectioneries, sweets, clothes, shoes, cinema, etc. Basically one can buy whatsoever one needs in this shopping mall. Prices are affordable. It's recommendable for one who likes sweet potato to buy Japanese style "Yellow Baked Sweet Potatoes" at the kiosk situated inside the Supermarket at B1. Tourists can buy good quality at affordable price of traditional recipe of baked pork slice (pork jerky) at Fragrance located at B1 (06 store). Parking facilities are available at reasonable price at $3 per entry. It takes 2-3 minutes walk from the Farrer Park MRT station. There are One Farrer Hotel & Park Hotel Farrer Park nearby (4-5 minutes walk), and Farrer Hospital.

REVIEW_TITLE: Modern mall at the fringe of Little India
REVIEW_BODY: This is a surprisingly huge and modern mall located near the fringe of Little India. The shop options are typical but what surprised me was the number of food options available. Not only that, some of these options are the rarer ones with only one or two in Singapore. There are also things to do for families with kids. I would definitely return with my family.

Indian visitors who stay around Kitchener road generally shop in Mustafa.
But this has changed as they find the stuff in Mustafa quite substandard.
The city square mall is a positive welcome.
This is an upmarket mall where the stuff is quite good albeit slightly pricey.
The new Japanese supermarket Don Don Donki is a great attraction. You get all the variety of Japanese products. It's a big superstore.
Wish I had more time to spend here.

This mall was opposite to the hotel where I stayed. The place is good. The food court on top level was interesting. Had some great chicken dimsums here. The shops are good. Variety of stores catering to all range of prices. The desert places yummy.

We went to City Square Mall to watch a movie in the cinema hall located here. It is a family-friendly mall and home to some 200 retail, entertainment, lifestyle and F&B stores. It is useful to the lifestyle needs of everyone in the family. They provide free wifi.
City Square Mall is located at the junction of Serangoon and Kitchener Roads. It is also close to Little India and Farrer Park MRT station. Locals and tourist shoppers are always seen here.
Called in at Beyond Pancakes only to be served an indescribably bad plate of nachos THE MALL is fine but give Beyond Pancakes a BIG THUMBS DOWN.

We frequented this mall 4 times in the week that we spent in Singapore. 5 stories of shopping,, very clean and full of things for the whole family.. we had dinner there 3 times and even bought a tablet computer. Good mix of stores.
Nice mall with a good selection of shops. Easy access and well maintained. Nice variety of European shops
We came here for a movie show screened at the Golden Village cinema located at the 5th floor of the mall. There is a Food Republic located at the 4th floor at reasonable price.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very good shopping and great bakeries for breakfast
REVIEW_BODY:
This is near little India where we were staying and right at the Farrer MRT station. We did not have breakfast included in our room. We did this deliberatey since we were going on a cruise in a few days and did not want to eat much but we needed something. We could only find Indian shops near us and no quick western, style breakfast items.

The City Square Mall was a perfect solution. They had a grocery store to get some fruit and two bakies (three if you count Starbucks) that opened before 8 AM with a huge fresh pastry choice at cheap prices.

Been many times, recently somethings have improved somethings have gone bad. Used to be very vibrant it all seems very flat and dead now. Local Food court is quite good now. The surrounding area has loads of restaurants and shops. Famous Little India is close by so is the 24/7 Mustafa Centre.

Located in the little India district, This Mall has a lot to offer in the way of shopping, from low to medium end shopping. Lots of clothing and household goods even a grocery. Lots of choices for what to eat, restaurants almost outnumber stores. There is also game area top floor.

Although its accessible by trains/mrt, honestly it is such a hassle to go through lots of interchange and alot of walking just to reach farrer park mrt.
Apart from that its pretty huge mall & lots of restaurants. Fast foods, snacks u name it.
What i like about this mall is there are alot of activities for kids.
Playground outside mall.
Kids Train ride(need to buy tickets)
A few indoor playgrounds (need to pay norm by hour)
Retailing for kids stuff. (Clothing, books, toys)

Of course on top of this u can get all other adults retail outlets in this mall.

& this mall is just walking distance to Mustafa shopping centre. & lots of indian foods around the area.
Nice clean and modern shopping mall near Little India. Plenty of eateries including American fast food outlets. Many levels to explore and also has a cinema. Farrer Park MRT is just across the road.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for shopping or eating out
REVIEW_BODY: What a gem, lots of places to eat and shop even a cinema, parking is in the basement and each floor is easily accessible by escalators.
We've ordered Pork chop, fiery chicken, escargot and mushroom soup for reasonable price. Food quality is good. nice ambience!

Nice variety menus. Drinks are also nice.
I had fried XO seafood noodles & ice lime tea. Noodle was nice & spicy . Tea had some distinctive favor, very nice & refreshing. My wife had shrimp dumpling noodle dry & iced lemongrass. Dumplings were good but noodle was bit sticky & mushy could be better in soup. Drink was very bland. They fire got my French fries.
Extremely convenient store for us to shop. There is a 2dollar shop on the top floor, which has every thing sold at 2 dollars. Good place to get souvenirs for friends and relatives.

REVIEW_TITLE: Convenient Mall @ The Fringe of Little India - IN YULETIDE GLOW
REVIEW_BODY:
The vibrant theme of Christmas catches your attention - in the stores, on the grounds. The Christmas village at its entrance jingles bells for all, naughty or nice.

A warren of tunnels fan leg traffic to the five retail levels of the mall. The Farrer Park MRT station moves people here.

The mall sits on the site of Singapore's historic New World Park. The definitive gate stands proudly at the grounds located at road level.

A good mix of stores and eateries characterizes the complex, which is touted as Singapore's first eco-mall.

International cuisine, street fare, food courts, lifestyle needs and services, bakeries, fast food giants, supermarkets, grocers, florists, pharmacies,wine merchants, money changers, banks etc - are all there.

At the taxi stand is a wheel-chair station, where caregivers to handicap visitors can button a call for help. The panel is braille friendly. Phenomenal.

Nearby is a collection box for donations towards Singapore's Wildlife Reserves Conservation Fund. This large 'piggy box' features 2 pangolins. Wow.

This mall is just right for last-minute shopping especially if you are staying near the area - Lavander, Mustafa Center, Little India. They have a mixed collection of stalls for souvenirs and fashion items.
This is a pretty big mall now its nothing compared to some of the other malls in Singapore but it has everything you need here and then some. Love the food republic here and loved the cinemas here!!

REVIEW_TITLE: Only big, modern mall in Little India.....
REVIEW_BODY:
You can find almost anything in general here, as expected of a big modern mall like this. The ambience is nice & they have a good mix of shops & dining here.

Best part is that this mall is connected underground directly to Farrer Park MRT station. For those yearning for international dining in Little India options, there is no other place than this mall. Also the clean toilets & cool comfort are big reliefs here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Our latest go-to mall if we are in the areA
REVIEW_BODY:
This mall is our latest go-to place if we are in the area as it has a wide variety of food options, ranging from Toastbox, Cedele, Breeks, Astons Specialities, old Town White Coffee, Face To Face Sarawak noodles, Watami and Paddington House of Pancakes, among others.

For fastfood options, there is Burger King and Macdonalds or, off an odd offshoot of the main mall, you can find Pizza Hut, located near Starhub. If you want a cheaper meal, there is the foodcourt on the 4th level, or countless small eateries like Subway and Stuffed！on the lower floors.

For everything supermarket related, NTUC is located on B1 where you can also find Singpost. Do also check out the Song fish store. There are a number of furniture and house-themed stores on the upper levels, including Daiso and American Furniture chain Picket and Rail. OCBC bank has a branch here in case you need cash to shop at the various shops such as Charles abd Keith (they sell cheaper shoes here than at other of their branches and this is popular especially with Thai shoppers), Cotton On, Bata, Giodano and Challenger. There are also electric animal rides for the younger ones.

The mall is located exactly at Farrer Park MRT station. My boyfriend and I stopped by to eat there since I stay at The Trey hostel which is located near to the mall. There're lots kinds of foods you can choose at the food court. I had some Korean dish and it was spicy and big portion. Worth to try.
Lot of stuffs to explore, got movie entertainment. Enjoyed roaming around the mall. Good for fsmily.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Big Mall near Little India.
REVIEW_BODY: The MRT station to alight heading to this mall would be Farrer Park. What i like about here will be patronizing decathlon. It's still a mall that has everything in case you're bored. Supermarket, Cinema, Eateries. Besides Ntuc supermarket, there's Donki Donki too and that's good choices to make. Looks like Malaysia Chiak has people coming to eat since the food is good too. Good crowd compared to MacDonald's which is beside.
Been to Sg many times but this was my first visit, since it's just walking distance from my hotel. Am impressed with the varieties of shops tenancy mix they have.

As a small country in relative terms, Singapore must have one of the highest in terms of percentage of shopping centres to each citizen. This shopping centre try to distinct itself from the rest by following the trend of eco-friendly. Escalators, lights and other energy consuming essentials are monitored on usage. I was mesmerised when the escalator I was on suddenly sprang to life when I stepped on it! Lights appear to get brighter when there are human passing traffic. There is a good range of retail outlets, with the Japanese theme very well represented. For visitors from outside Asia, the now defunct American company Toys r us has a branch here under the management of the Asian offshoot. It's a shopping centre ideally suited for families with children.
City Square Mall is a convenient place and have Donki Store and many restaurant. It ’s recommended shopping mall for family and kids.

there is a McDonalds located in the basement floor
which is surprisingly not even mentioned on Google maps
where you can have good burgers
otherwise do not recommend buying anything in the mall
as its very very expensive
there is a alternative medicine shop named GNC
where you can buy some good medicines
opposite to it is a departmental store for groceries
there is a Starbucks coffee shop also

This has become my usual Saturday afternoon hangout place, since I have to be around the area for classes for the kids. Decathlon is a great place to get sports gear at a good price. I love the food republic here with that high ceiling. Koi and Old chang kee are all time favourites.

I really like this mall. The size is just perfect for a shopper like me. I am more of a grab and go person and I dislike spending huge amount of time window shopping and this mall fits my criteria. It has all the shops that you need and it is also very convenient and easily accessible by MRT. It has serve the community around the Little India area well.
This feel just like any other malls in Singapore but what I feel they do have a wide selection of F&B, ranging from fast food to nice restaurants. They also have a GV cinema as well.

This is a small mall by Singapore standards and for the most part serves the surrounding Little India community. If you are in the area and looking for western fare as in McDonald’s and similar you will find it all here. There are also movies at the cinema complex housed within. Ok but not a show stopper sort of place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Affordable Shopping At A Strategic Area
REVIEW_BODY: This is an awesome mall. Even though retail business in Singapore is "dying", this mall is pretty call....not too big, not too small and offers great deals. There is also a very decent food court at the top floor and Farrer Park MRT Station is just opposite the shopping mall. Very convenient and you will never go hungry here as it filled with heaps of F&B outlets here. You can spend a good deal of time here.

I had to kill around some 4 hours before my flight after a happening day at Universal Studios. I searched n found City Square Mall, thanks to the reviewers at Trip Advisor.
If you are looking for an affordable shopping experience especially for buying gifts etc,then this is the place. You may find just a couple of big brands over here while the rest will be the ones where youll find some good sales/discounts. Its a small mall but packed with some good shops and stuff. You will also find a Cinema at the top floor which became a good past time for me.

City Square is a Eco Mall which utilises many green features and initiatives to reduce energy use & help save the environment. Conveniently located atop Farrer Park Mrt station & near the tourist attraction of Little India, this relatively spacious Mall boasts amenities such as a supermarket, cinema, food court & many food and retail options. Worth a visit if you are in the area, especially to cool off in the often hot local weather!

singapore so many mall and all diffetent style actually here like a corridor mall.dont like much but its depends vary from person to person 3 floor have cheap and nice restaraunt and up 4 floor nice cinema saloon
Walking distance from little india is this mall,nice stores,restaurants and clothing stores can be found here

REVIEW_TITLE: Good mall for practical, everyday things
REVIEW_BODY:
I stayed over the road from this mall and used it quite often. I bought a Singtel sim from a shop here and fruit from a small supermarket (both these in the basement). There are at least two pharmacies, and a number of restaurants, both Asian and western - I ate here a couple of times, cheaply and well. The customer services desk is a ticket outlet for SISTIC - I collected my ticket for Chingay from here.

A good, practical mall for essential items that you have forgotten to bring or discover you need while on the trip.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to stop if you walk from MRT Farrer Park to Mustafa Centre
REVIEW_BODY: Recommend shop: Fair Price supermarket at basement 1 Fruit shop at Basement 2 McD Resto Singapore Mint (gold coin) Cinema/Bioskop This mall toilet is very clean.

REVIEW_TITLE: All in one place for a day to day life
REVIEW_BODY: This mall almost have all the things that one must need.. been there to collect some coupons and found that it has lots of food options from Mcdonalds to KFC to other Food Joints to lots of Branded shopping Outlets, it has everything for all, even at the higher floors there are offices whic makes it a nice place ..

REVIEW_TITLE: Quite a good shopping mall with most things you would need
REVIEW_BODY: Located right next to Farrer Park MRT and on the edge of Little India this is a good mall that provides a lot in terms of places to eat movie theatres good selection of shops and good location. This is not a designer mall so to speak but serves both locals and tourists.

I visited this place with my mother and we had a couple of meals from two different restaurants and it was a nice experience. Shopping wise the items were a little bit pricey but Im assuming that those are there standard rates and such, so no complains there.
Just another neighbourhood mall which is very crowded during weekends. But weekdays are not so crowded. This mall basement usually the race pack collection point for some Singapore races!
Very nice mall in Little India, Singapore. Great variety of shopping, great variety of foods, even though I didn't eat or shop here. Neat, clean, well maintained.

This mall is located at Farrer Park Mrt ( purple line ) exit h. You have few stores and restaurants there.. There is a golden village to watch cinema at level 4, Daiso, a bookstore, uniqlo, charles and keith.. typical stores. Not recommended for tourists.
Nothing unique, just the same like every other mall I know, it was ok, but 10-15 minutes and I found myself bored... Moshe
Very well decorated shopping center. They have also many international vendors. They have variety food stall which name is food republic. Everybody should go there once.

I was hanging out in this place for all three days that I stayed there and I loooved it and Im back in Sri Lanka and I'm already missing the place. When I go to Singapore again then this place would be my number one place to do the shopping and of course experience the food adventures as well. I'd Recommend this place to everyone.

For those staying in the Lavender / Little India area, this Mall is a perfect place to spend some green on some good merchandise. One stop for most of your brand requirements. Lots of food options and play stuff for kids.

This was a small mall where most shops were not a shoppers delight. There was food court on top floor. On the ground floor there were some good shops. Not worth more than 1 hour. It would be walking distance to Mustafa center.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just Opposite to Park Royal Hotel
REVIEW_BODY: Many shops were in the Mall, Many in 4th floor 1$ shop Daiso is very Famous in this mall. Many offers available in the Mall.
This is a mall for locals for groceries and eating.There are shops and a good selection of food outlets.If you have time and close by come here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Walk around Mall after Teochew Porridge Buffet Lunch
REVIEW_BODY: My friends and I walked around the Mall and were pleasantly surprised to see children playing and walking on a few rope nettings hung across the atrium & the 3rd, 4th and 5th storeys. It was certainly very interesting and exciting to watch the children enjoying themselves. The Food Republic FoodCourt @ the 5th storey has interesting Peranakan Facades for the stalls. It is pleasant to visit and shop at this huge Eco Mall.

This mall caters to not only the young but also the old, but young at heart. There are countless of restaurants with every cuisine you can ask for. For tired parents: Rest and relax at Coffeemin (less than $10 per hour) and enjoy the free flow of beverages and snacks, plus relive your childhood days by playing some board games or using game consoles to access to a wide variety of online games. For children: Just outside Coffeemin is the haven to most children (Airzone). It is more than 3 storys high (for adventure seekers). You get to climb up nets to advance to the next story and slide down the steep slide that will surely give you the adrenalin rush. There is also a movie theatre, Golden Village, with comfortable seats and brilliant films.
You would never regret coming to City Square Mall.

REVIEW_TITLE: Place I visit almost every week.
REVIEW_BODY: This mall have OCBC Bank which I need the most. And there food court is nice (Hainanese Chicken and My favourite old aunties are in Juice and Coffee stall.. I really thank to all the old aunties for being there for so Long time. At least for last 3 or 4 years I see them whenever I go there... and decathlon store is good to visitthere.there are so many other good store are there like fair price, best, challenger, Daiso uniclo and the golden village movie theatre.
From Mc Donald's to great singapore food excellent place to eat Good selection of food and easy access to Little India. Try the Street Cafe food is great and cheap.
when i was there always visit for movies so many times in a week very good place for shopping everything is on one place we can find full package

Just right beside the Farrer park MRT station, this place is so easily to be accessed. There are a lot of shops located in City Square mall. Fast food outlets like MC Donald and KFC are also located at this mall also.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not too big, not too small, good selection of shops
REVIEW_BODY: I like this moderate-size mall located close to Little India. The layout is nice and organized and one wouldn't get lost. There is a good selection of shops for everyday needs and restaurants serving various cuisines. It is nice to walk around here and browse and have a bite or two to eat.

As a tourist, this mall is a great spot to visit. One of the places we went on our first day. Accesible to MRTs and busses, this is a nice and comfortable place to relax and stroll. Packed with people not just local but also a number of tourists. A place where diverse race are in and working cooperatively with each other. Great architecture and good shoppes to go.

We recently went to Singapore and stayed at the Park Hotel Farrer Park. This mall is really close to this hotel. We used this mall for many of our meals. We also found the supermarket in the basement very useful.

McDonald's was great for breakfast and for ice cream cones. I found the Popeyes restaurant was as good as at home, and my friend found the same with Pizza Hut. We also enjoyed a couple of the food booths on the top floor. I liked the fish in the Hoe Heng Korean booth and my friend liked the pork in the You Men W.K. Roast booth. The prices in all these places were very reasonable.

Plenty of places to eat we ate here several times great value for money loads of places to shop clean toilets also has gym outside had paw patrol theme for children and some rides for children to go on

City Square Mall has many outlets for shopping. It is the best place near Little India to have a great meal at mid-range prices. There is a food court spread across a whole florr. Recommend "Decathalon" outlet for hiking gear and sportswear and Chick-A-Boo for a tasty meal.
It’s a great Mall to just hang out. Walk around, good food there. One of the best mall around Little India Singapore.

Conveniently located in connection with Farrer Park MRT station, it has almost every basic necessities from grocery, gym,pharmacies, food court, cinema and one of the most environmentally friendly malls with plenty of natural lightings. Good family mall with many weekend activities.

Like most malls in singapore, this one is just at Farrer Park MRT. The layout is good, easily to walk about and good selection of food outlets. It was of course crowded on a Saturday but still was able to walk about easily.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The place is large, Clean and plenty of shopping options. close to MRT and tends to be crowded during weekends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Farrer Park Station & City Square Mall
REVIEW_BODY:
Its always a pleasure to be back to this part of Singapore(irs been nearly 3yrs.) I move hostel to hostel, work related shuttling between China town n Lavender. My colleague treat me to Wok Master the choice of 3flavour Crab promo for 2pcs @$39.90 instead of $60. I had an hour of foot massage at Heart Spring with my regular masseuer. Did alittle shopping and catching up with Gss(Great Singapore Sale) going on this time of the year. Great place for Retail Theraphy. Love this mall, l can get everyrhing done under one roof
Of course the convenience of transportation the Mrt is just linked in there. Bus stops are all over to whereevergood stuff

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice mall with various buying options & movie theatre
REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice mall located in Little India with each access to public transport & easy access to ample of choices for Indian food. It encompasses varied range of shops with branded goods, several dining options, grocery options, household goods & a movie theatre.

We came here for a movie show `Patriots Day' screened at the Golden Village cinema located at the 5th floor of the mall. The event was organized by the People's Association.

I have been to several malls in Singapore but this is my first time I visited this mall. I took the purple line from Outram Park and alighted at Farrer Park station. Once you came out from the MRT station and walked for a short distance and you are in the mall itself. It is located at the junction of Serangoon Road and Kitchener Road

The mall is lustrously modern, clean, big and convenient. The charges for the basement parking is quite reasonable. I came at 6.30 pm and departed at 10.30 pm and the car park charge is a flat rate of $3/-. Weekday parking is free if you spent $60/- at the mall subject to some terms and conditions.

There is a Food Republic located at the 4th floor at reasonable price with nice design. also visited two Chinese medical halls and bought some herbal stuff. The spacious and well designed NTUC Fair price supermarket at Basement 1 seem to attract the most customers. The wide range of fast food outlets like Pizza Hut, Macdonald, KFC, Subway, etc gave customers more choices and options.

The mall is the first eco-mall but I am no expert to distinguish the difference between this mall and the rest of the neighborhood malls. I understand there are a number of installations and designs in the architectural make-up of the mall that reduce energy consumption.

At the customer service counter, there are some signs on donate your excess food and disposal of irreparable electrical appliances. Seem a bit different in their operations.

It is comfortable and a pleasure to `soak' in this pleasant and eco-friendly mall and slowly explore the mall facility for a few hours.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place for families and kids
REVIEW_BODY: City Square, and the newer extension City Square2 are both very family oriented malls, a lot of shops and tuition agencies for kids, if you like LEGO the ToysRUs have a large section and in the basement there is a Hello Kitty shop. Food court is nice but the one in CS2 is even better. Try the fish'n'chips.
A nice family oriented mall with the usual suspects. No luxury brands to intimidate shoppers, just midrange stores and plenty of food choices. You can do your groceries and banking under one roof.
